diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute myeloid leukemia with a t(11q23) translocation, with involvement of the skin (leukemia cutis)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's age, appearance and distribution of lesions, and overall health suggested urticaria pigmentosa. A biopsy indicated an infiltrate consistent with acute myeloid leukemia, supported by immunohistochemical findings and subsequent detection of a t(11q23) translocation.
